byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces that he will pardon thousands of people convicted of nonviolent crimes when they were teenagers, provided that they have not had any other convictions in at least decade; moves comes as attempts to reform criminal justice system have met with roadblocks in state's Legislature.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said the plan was part of a larger push toward helping nonviolent offenders assimilate back into society.

headline.main: Cuomo Moves to Pardon Former Youthful Offenders
headline.print_headline: Cuomo’s Focus in Pardon Push: Youth Offenses

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said the plan was part of a larger push toward helping nonviolent offenders assimilate back into society.
